It belongs to the genus Abies in the family Pinaceae, characterized by its needle-like leaves and cone-bearing structure. The tree typically grows in mountainous regions, preferring cool, moist climates with well-drained soil. Its foliage is dense and dark green, often retaining its color year-round. The Mexican fir plays a significant ecological role in its native habitat, providing shelter and food for various wildlife species.
